ASI Create offers simulation environments for educational tech. Using agent-based models from https://fetch.ai/ educators can experiment with new teaching methods and personalized learning solutions before full-scale rollout.

3. AI-Powered Micro-Education Studios Expert courses, tailored to micro-niches How AI helps: - Auto-generate video lessons, scripts, thumbnails, worksheets - Turn long content into structured courses - Personalised learning paths for each student - AI tutors to boost retention

I'm planning to create an AI tool school. It would be for anyone who wants to learn how to actually apply useful AI tools to your life. Rough ideas: - 1 class per week - A new tool every week + exactly how to apply it - 1-1.5 hour-long classes, interactive for any questions - Classes will be live + recorded - Members can vote every week for the next AI tool to breakdown - Possible testing + certifications? With the pace of updates to AI tools, a standalone course would be challenging to update, so this weekly model would be better. Who would be interested?

clusters.winning_insights: AI education tools often win when they incorporate gamification and personalization, like quiz platforms with real-time feedback. Non-winners typically lack user engagement features.

I didn't win the hackathon i just participated in, but i'll share what I built under 2 hours, A fully functional AI-Powered medical system that uses local AI model to help in assigning patients to doctors and wards, Keeping checks of patients data, Analytics, Audits and also for carrying out full medical works simulated, Easening up the workload of medical staff, Which falls in line with my last hackathon project: A medtech solution that is built on blockDag blockchain, that uses nfc card to store encrypted keys that are used to store patients medical record Both are multi layered encrypted, hopefully i'll be able to win my next hackathon, but till then cheers! and congrats to the winners

We hosted a AI healthcare hackathon focused on B2B problems - read the post and you might get ideas for other vertical AI stuff too. Some example projects built from scratch in 36 hours: - A tool to let recruiters know when a physicians might be looking for a new job - A tool that uses AI to judge other healthcare AI to see if their claims are legit - An easier way to help get all the information needed to enroll someone in long-term care And 10 other projects. Here's a round up of all the projects people made (in the next tweet)

Building a startup? Focus on timeless problems, the ones people never stop caring about: > Fitness ‚Üí AI calorie tracker, workout planner > Studying ‚Üí AI tutor, flashcard or quiz generator > Productivity ‚Üí AI planner, focus or habit coach > Money ‚Üí AI finance tracker or dropshipping helper > Beauty ‚Üí AI skincare or makeup assistant > Memory ‚Üí AI note-taker, summarizer, or mind-map generator > Mental health ‚Üí AI mood, therapy, or sleep coach > Photography ‚Üí AI photo editor, caption or style generator > Food ‚Üí AI meal planner, grocery or recipe assistant > Relationships ‚Üí AI dating coach, conversation guide > Health ‚Üí AI symptom checker, rehab or wellness tracker > Travel ‚Üí AI itinerary or trip planner These spaces never fade. People will always pay for solutions to everyday needs.
Own solution: Community-driven AI hubs. Blend A and B with local
using AI for real-time screenings and virtual coaching. No more one-size-fits-all‚Äîtailored to genetics, habits, and environment. This could redefine healthcare equity.

clusters.winning_insights: Health AI projects win when they address critical issues like mental health or risk prediction with ethical considerations. Non-winners often miss integration with real-world data.

Introducing Water Wise BITS! Born at the Dojima Foundation Hackathon, this project from @bitshyd focuses on water conservation through advanced tech & sustainable solutions. Check out the full video of this transformative initiative: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Iw1bYrVXkH4&feature=youtu.be #WaterBITS #Sustainability #TechForGood
Eco-Innovation from Waste:
in India turns floral waste from temples into sustainable products like incense and compost, tackling river pollution with a smart business model and strong social mission.

Follow us @club_kab  to learn more about young entrepreneurs. #GDI #SDGs #Youth2030 #WYDF #APGYD NO.23 The Greenie Project - Learn and Be Rewarded [Edenworld Conservation Initiative] This program relies on the

platform for implementation. People who sign up on the platform can take courses on climate change. After learning, they will get virtual points. The virtual points redeemed after taking the courses can be exchanged for scholarships, some paid courses, and cash support for tree planting programs. The uniqueness of this program lies in its strong technical support, with the founder developing a barcode system for tree recognition. When people scan the barcode, it will display all the detailed information about the trees. Currently, this program has started in a local community by helping in the biodiversity conservation of the community, and a total of 500 trees were donated there.

Some example projects built from scratch in 36 hours: - A tool to let recruiters know when a physicians might be looking for a new job - A tool that uses AI to judge other healthcare AI to see if their claims are legit - An easier way to help get all the information needed to enroll someone in long-term care And 10 other projects. Here's a round up of all the projects people made (in the next tweet)

Got into YC office yesterday for the YC Hackathon. Everyone there was cracked. Saw some intense discussions and whiteboarding too. I teamed up on-site, built fast, soaked in inspo and learned how to crush short 8-hr hackathons - - Pick a problem that you can demo well - Plan REALLY well before the event starts: idea, design, tasks, how to use/ integrate sponsors and how to demo. - Don't miss the finalists demos and learn from them. They were chosen for a reason. These two were my personal favs - - Turn any camera into a smart monitor that you can set alerts in natural language. - Billboards that create and swap ads in real time based on local news + twitter feeds And don't forget to take the mandatory photo with YC logo with your teammates @adi_suresh01 @AkritiKeswani @Laylaliuuu

For parents of children with disabilities who may not be able to use tiny buttons & switches on toys, finding accessible must-have toys can be a struggle. This week NorQuest hosted Hacking The Holidays, where volunteers adapted toys to make them accessible at no cost to parents.
